fields.description:
Responses to DescribeProperties queries are inconsistent in how they represent unset properties.  Specifically, some of them return empty euca:value elements, while others return euca:value elements with <unset> as their contents.  I recommend always returning an empty element and letting the tool decide how to represent it rather than fabricating a value on the server.

FWIW, requestbuilder is fine with empty elements and nonexistent elements, and it can tell the difference between them.  It currently ignores xsi:nil, but I could change that if needed.
fields.summary: Property lists represent unset values inconsistently

comments.body:
Originally posted on 2012-01-04 23:24:46

Wed Jan 04 15:24:46 2012: Request 5482 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Ticket created by garrett.holmstrom
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: Property lists represent unset values inconsistently
       Owner: Nobody
  Requestors: 
      Status: new
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5482 >


Responses to DescribeProperties queries are inconsistent in how they represent unset properties.  Specifically, some of them return empty euca:value elements, while others return euca:value elements with <unset> as their contents.

I recommend always returning an empty element and letting the tool decide how to represent it rather than fabricating a value on the server.

Originally posted on 2012-01-04 23:30:06 by rusvika
> while others return euca:value elements

> with <unset> as their contents.

  
To be exact, <unset> will be returned. Is '>' intentionally not ">"?

Originally posted on 2012-01-04 23:30:08 by admin
https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5482 This is a comment.
It is not sent to the Requestor(s): > while others return euca:value elements
> with <unset> as their contents. To be exact, <unset> will be returned. Is
'>' intentionally not ">"?

Originally posted on 2012-01-05 00:28:38
On Wed, 4 Jan 2012 15:30:06 -0800, vika.felmetsger wrote: > > while others
return euca:value elements > > with <unset> as their contents. > > To be
exact, <unset> will be returned. Is '>' intentionally not ">"? That's amusing.
I wonder if the code that escapes the string is wrong.

Originally posted on 2012-01-05 00:28:39 by admin
Sending the previous mail has failed. Please contact your admin, they can find
more details in the logs.

Originally posted on 2012-01-06 18:42:48 by tjcramer

Fri Jan 06 10:42:48 2012: Request 5482 was acted upon.
 Transaction: Given to dan.nurmi by tim.cramer
       Queue: Engineering Bugs
     Subject: Property lists represent unset values inconsistently
       Owner: dan.nurmi
  Requestors: 
      Status: open
 Ticket <URL: https://support.eucalyptus.com/Ticket/Display.html?id=5482 >


This transaction appears to have no content
assigning to ken for CLC team discussion

As far as I can see there are few options. First, unify return view for the unset element. There are few recommendations how to do that. I am personally leaning towards Steve's suggestions with xsi:nil="true". Second option would be to have an extra input parameter for describe properties that would dictates it output so client could specify an unset value format.
Let me know your preferences.

If I recall correctly, euca2ools' XML parsers pay no attention to attributes, so as long as the element has no contents it shouldn't break anything.  We should definitely test that to make sure, though.

AWS's convention for an element with no value seems to be only an empty element.  In fact, I am not aware of a service that uses any attributes at all, apart from the root element's xmlns attribute, but then again they now have _27_ API guides and I have only read ten.  8^)
[~vasya], can you fill in the Component field for this issue?  Thanks!

The issue still persists in 4.2.0. 
[root@e-11 ~]# euca-describe-properties services.database.worker.keyname
PROPERTY	services.database.worker.keyname	{}		
[root@e-11 ~]# euca-describe-properties one.storage.autosnapshots 
PROPERTY	one.storage.autosnapshots	<unset>

I think the current fix prevents configuration of blockstorage:

{code}
#
# euca-modify-property -p one.storage.blockstoragemanager=das
Error(ModifyPropertyValueType): Cannot change extant storage backend configuration. You must deregister all SCs in the partition before you can change the configuration value
#
#
{code}

Disregard my previous comment. It just prevents the configuration of blockstorage that is unset.
I just pushed the changes to master because the previous one broke QA.
